title: Identification of Information Structures in Bayesian Games
abstract: arXiv:2403.11333v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: To what extent can an external observer observing an equilibrium action distribution in an incomplete information game infer the underlying information structure? We investigate this issue in a general linear-quadratic-Gaussian framework. A simple class of canonical information structures is offered and proves rich enough to rationalize any possible equilibrium action distribution that can arise under an arbitrary information structure. We show that the class is parsimonious in the sense that the relevant parameters can be uniquely pinned down by an observed equilibrium outcome, up to some qualifications. Our result implies, for example, that the accuracy of each agent's signal about the state is identified, as measured by how much observing the signal reduces the state variance. Moreover, we show that a canonical information structure characterizes the lower bound on the amount by which each agent's signal can reduce the state variance,

translated_title: 在贝叶斯博弈中识别信息结构
translated_abstract: 在一个不完全信息博弈中，一个外部观察者观察到的均衡行动分布能够多大程度地推断出潜在的信息结构？我们在一个一般的线性二次高斯框架中研究了这个问题。我们提供了一个简单的基Canonical信息结构类，并证明足够丰富，可以合理解释任何可能在任意信息结构下出现的均衡行动分布。
tldr: 研究了如何通过观察均衡行动分布来推断不完全信息博弈中的信息结构，提出了一个能够合理解释任意均衡行动分布的Canonical信息结构类。
